So while artificial sweeteners may seem like an easy way to cut calories, the potential health consequences are significant and far-reaching. For example, a 2014 review by the EFSA found that aspartame, one of the most widely used artificial sweeteners, was safe at current intake levels and did not cause cancer or other health issues. 3) Individual reactions vary. While most people seem to tolerate artificial sweeteners fine, a small percentage report sensitivities. 

4) Safety and effectiveness are two different things. Even if a sweetener is safe, that doesn't necessarily mean it will help with weight loss or health.
